page.title: 09Dunge Hamlet cont.
page.content:
still filled with water and is thought to have surrounded a medieval manor house. The site which has not been ex- cavated to date, is scheduled by the D.o.E. as a Wiltshire Monument. (no.567) Grange Farm belongs to the Gadd family. It is 200 acres in size. and has a dairy herd of 150 friesian cows. Mr. Gadd also owns a racing stud of 5 horses and ponies. He also has 5 more in training. He keeps 1 black stallion for breeding.
When I visited Grange Farm I liked the stallion best because he seemed gentle in the stable, but I doubt that he would be very nice out- side. Mr Gadd said he could kill some- body if they didn't know how to handle him the right way. Neil Duff aged 9.
